location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.2016 of 1856 from Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay, to Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: The letter and its enclosure relate to the recent act of piracy at Sharjah, in which the cargo of a vessel was plundered by members of the Wahabee [Wahhābī] tribe. Anderson encloses a disposition with his letter, entitled “The Information of Oosman Moossa, inhabitant of Bombay” (folios 67-70), dated 15 April 1856. The text is a testimony by the owner of the vessel in question, in which he describes the attack upon the boat by 1,500 Wahhābīs at Sharjah, his meeting with the Native Agent at Sharjah, Hajee Jacoob [Hajjī Yaqoob], and his return to Bombay.
